definitions.definition: to bend something, especially paper or cloth, so that one part of it lies on the other part, or to be able to be bent in this way:
examples: I folded the letter (in half) and put it in an envelope.
She folded her baby in a blanket.

definitions.definition: to bring your arms close to your chest and hold them together
to move a part of your body into a position where it is close to your body:
examples: She sat with her legs folded under her.

definitions.definition: a line or mark where paper, cloth, etc. was or is folded:
examples: Make a fold across the centre of the card.

definitions.definition: a bend in a layer of rock under the earth's surface caused by movement there
having the stated number of parts, or multiplied by the stated number:
